home.description: Forsa is a dynamic non-profit based in Trougout, Driouch, committed to education, social integration, and youth empowerment through cultural, educational, and sports initiatives. It serves all segments of the local population, fostering solidarity, lifelong learning, and active citizenship.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To support education, culture, and social development in Trougout through inclusive programs that empower youth and strengthen community ties.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A community where everyone has the chance to learn, grow, and actively contribute to a better future.

impact.title: Our Impact
impact.subtitle: Together, we're making a real difference in communities across the region

callToAction.title: Ready to make a difference?
callToAction.description: Join our community of changemakers and help us create more opportunities for those who need them most.

upcomingGuidance.title: Forsa Association Announces Upcoming Academic Guidance Session for Trougout High School Students
upcomingGuidance.summary: Forsa Association is preparing to launch its first major educational initiative with an academic and career guidance session for high school students in Trougout, featuring local alumni sharing their experiences.
upcomingGuidance.content:
Forsa Association for Socio-Educational and Sports Development is excited to announce its upcoming academic guidance session for students at Trougout Qualifying High School.

Scheduled for May 20, 2025, this inaugural event will be held under the inspiring theme 'From Trougout to the Future' and represents a significant milestone for the newly established association.

The session, titled 'Trougout Graduates Return Carrying Their Experiences for the Next Generation to Invest,' will bring together distinguished local alumni who have pursued diverse academic and professional paths to share their valuable experiences with current students.

Confirmed speakers include:
• Mohamed Afkir from the National School of Applied Sciences in Al Hoceima, specializing in Data Engineering
• Abubakar Bourbain from the Multidisciplinary Faculty in Nador, Department of Public Law
• Mohamed Baouch from the Faculty of Sciences and Technologies in Al Hoceima, PhD in Environmental Chemistry and Water Treatment
• Professor Moussa Afarmas, who will offer insights into Sociology and Philosophy post-Baccalaureate opportunities

The comprehensive program will feature interactive workshops including cultural competitions, motivation and stress management sessions, and 'Share your Baccalaureate experience' workshops facilitated by school teachers.

This initiative reflects Forsa Association's commitment to supporting education and youth empowerment in the Trougout region. The association aims to create a bridge between past graduates and current students, fostering community solidarity and inspiring the next generation to pursue their academic and professional goals.

The event is organized in partnership with the administration of Trougout Qualifying High School and expects to benefit approximately 60 students with the support of dedicated volunteers.

guidanceSuccess.title: Successful Launch: Academic and Career Guidance Session Empowers Local Students
guidanceSuccess.summary: Forsa Association successfully launched its first major initiative with a comprehensive guidance seminar for high school students in Trougout, featuring alumni sharing their academic and career experiences.
guidanceSuccess.content:
Forsa Association for Socio-Educational and Sports Development marked a significant milestone with the successful launch of its inaugural guidance seminar for students at Trougout Qualifying High School.

Held on May 20, 2025, under the inspiring theme 'From Trougout to the Future,' this event brought together local alumni who have pursued diverse academic and professional paths to share their experiences with the next generation.

The seminar, titled 'Trougout Graduates Return Carrying Their Experiences for the Next Generation to Invest,' represented more than just an educational session—it was a powerful demonstration of community solidarity and the commitment to youth empowerment.

Distinguished guests included:
• Mohamed Afkir from the National School of Applied Sciences in Al Hoceima, specializing in Data Engineering
• Abubakar Bourbain from the Multidisciplinary Faculty in Nador, Department of Public Law
• Mohamed Baouch from the Faculty of Sciences and Technologies in Al Hoceima, PhD in Environmental Chemistry and Water Treatment
• Professor Moussa Afarmas, offering insights into Sociology and Philosophy post-Baccalaureate

The comprehensive program featured interactive workshops including cultural competitions, motivation and stress management sessions, and 'Share your Baccalaureate experience' workshops with school teachers.

The event created a vibrant educational atmosphere with strong interaction among participants—students, teachers, and facilitators—inspiring the association's leadership to continue their mission with renewed energy. This success has strengthened the organization's commitment to civic engagement and youth empowerment in the Trougout region.

With approximately 60 student beneficiaries and the collaboration of 3 dedicated volunteers, this initiative has set a strong foundation for future educational programs and community development activities.

guidanceSessions.title: Academic and Career Guidance Session
guidanceSessions.description: Organizing orientation sessions to help high school students make informed academic and career choices.
guidanceSessions.detailedDescription:
Forsa Association for Socio-Educational and Sports Development marked a significant milestone by launching its inaugural guidance seminar for students at Trougout Qualifying High School.

Held on May 20, 2025, under the inspiring theme 'From Trougout to the Future,' this groundbreaking event brought together distinguished alumni to share their academic and professional journeys with the next generation.

The seminar, titled 'Trougout Graduates Return Carrying Their Experiences for the Next Generation to Invest,' represented more than just an educational session—it was a powerful demonstration of community solidarity and commitment to youth empowerment.

The comprehensive program featured:
• Welcome reception and official opening ceremonies
• Inspiring speeches from Association President, School Principal, and School Life Coordinator
• Distinguished guest presentations and interactive discussions

Esteemed speakers included:
• Mohamed Afkir from the National School of Applied Sciences in Al Hoceima, specializing in Data Engineering
• Abubakar Bourbain from the Multidisciplinary Faculty in Nador, Department of Public Law
• Mohamed Baouch from the Faculty of Sciences and Technologies in Al Hoceima, PhD in Environmental Chemistry and Water Treatment
• Professor Moussa Afarmas, offering valuable insights into Sociology and Philosophy post-Baccalaureate opportunities

Enhancing the educational experience, interactive workshops included:
• Cultural competitions promoting intellectual engagement
• Motivation and stress management sessions for academic success
• 'Share your Baccalaureate experience' workshops featuring valuable contributions from school teachers

The event fostered a vibrant educational atmosphere with meaningful interaction among participants—students, teachers, and facilitators. This success has inspired the association's leadership to continue their mission with renewed energy and commitment.

This initiative represents a promising foundation for the association's ongoing efforts to strengthen civic engagement and youth empowerment throughout the Trougout region.

donate.title: Support Our Cause
donate.subtitle: Your contribution makes a difference
donate.description: Your donation helps us continue our mission of creating opportunities for all. Every contribution, regardless of size, has a meaningful impact on the communities we serve.

bankTransfer.title: Bank Transfer Details
bankTransfer.description: You can support our mission by making a direct bank transfer using the details below. Simply visit your bank agency or use online banking to send your donation.
bankTransfer.noteText: Please include "Donation - Your Name" in the transfer reference to help us track your contribution. You can also send us an email at association.forsa.trougout@gmail.com or a WhatsApp message to +212 675 900 514 to notify us of your donation.

impact.title: Your Impact
impact.small: Provides educational materials for one student for a month
impact.medium: Sponsors vocational training for one individual
impact.description: Your generous contribution will help us continue our mission to create opportunities for the community. We believe in transparency and accountability, and we ensure that your donation is used effectively to create positive change.

callToAction.title: Every Contribution Matters
callToAction.description: Whether big or small, your donation makes a difference in someone's life. Join us in creating a better future for all.
